com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image
Interface Interpolator

All Known Implementing Classes:
Interpolator.BilinearInterpolator
public interface Interpolator

Defines how an image should retrieve a value from neighboring pixels when the requested values coordinates don't define an exact pixel. For exmaple, if you have one pixel at 5,7 which is white and another at 5,8 which is black and the pixel at 5,7.5 is requested it is reasonable to assume that pixel would probably be some kind of gray.

Interpolators typically assume the true image is a continuous function and the image we have is a mere sampling of that function. Given that, if we assume the image is smooth it makes sense that neighboring pixels could be used to define the value of pixels which were not sampled.

There are a number of ways to interpolate pixels, the typical trade-off is a cost to accuracy tradeoff. The simplest methods do little math but return imperfect results while the more complex methods involve more math and are more expensive.

Nested Class Summary
static class Interpolator.BilinearInterpolator
           Calculates a pixel value from the 4 closest neighbors using bilinear interpolation.
 
Method Summary
 double interpolate(double x, double y, int b, Image source)
          Interpolates a value where the coordinates are not integers by taking the neighbors of the desired point and making some guesses about what the true value should be.
 

Method Detail

interpolate

double interpolate(double x,
                   double y,
                   int b,
                   Image source)
Interpolates a value where the coordinates are not integers by taking the neighbors of the desired point and making some guesses about what the true value should be.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the pixel
y - The y coordinate of the pixel
b - The band that we want the value for
source - The source image, used to obtain neighboring pixels
Returns:
An interpolated guess at the true value of the desired pixel
